context_evidences: - Pfizer, Inc. is named after Charles Pfizer, who founded the biotech and pharmaceutical company, then named Charles Pfizer & Company, in 1849. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2023/02/fact-check-pfizer-spelled-backward-rezifp-is-not-god-of-plague-and-underworld.html published on 2023-02-08 13:07:00

- The vaccine's naming process began early in 2020 during the shot's development. Brand Institute , a naming agency specializing in developing brand names and identities, began working with BioNTech on the vaccine's name in April 2020 before Pfizer joined the branding team, later on, reports Jaclyn Diaz for NPR. Reference: https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/meaning-behind-pfizerbiontechs-vaccine-moniker-comirnaty-180978535/ published on 2021-08-30 06:30:00

- Born in the former German state of Württemberg as Karl Pfizer on March 22, 1824, Charles Pfizer immigrated to the U.S. in the 1840s, according to the online American history project Immigrant Entrepreneurship. With his cousin Charles Erhart, Pfizer founded Charles Pfizer & Company in 1849 in Brooklyn, New York, notes the biotech company. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2023/02/fact-check-pfizer-spelled-backward-rezifp-is-not-god-of-plague-and-underworld.html published on 2023-02-08 13:07:00

- FDA approval for a prescription drug name is a lengthy process, and its requirements span in detail across a 42-page document , Insider reports. Names for drugs must be memorable but not easily confused with other brands. Words are allowed to refer to the drug's technology but not to any of the active ingredients in them, per Insider. Reference: https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/meaning-behind-pfizerbiontechs-vaccine-moniker-comirnaty-180978535/ published on 2021-08-30 06:30:00
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. Pfizer, spelled backward as Rezifp, does not mean 'the Burner' or 'the Ravager' in Hebrew. The company Pfizer is named after its founder, Charles Pfizer, and has no connection to any ancient deities. Furthermore, the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine is officially named Comirnaty, a term representing a mash-up of the words Covid-19, community, immunity, and mRNA. The name has no relation to the term 'Rezifp'. 
https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2023/02/fact-check-pfizer-spelled-backward-rezifp-is-not-god-of-plague-and-underworld.html
https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/meaning-behind-pfizerbiontechs-vaccine-moniker-comirnaty-180978535/
note_1_text: Pfizer bears the name of one of its cofounders, Karl Pfizer. The name Pfizer is German in origin.    https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pfizer?wprov=sfti1  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Pfizer?wprov=sfti1  https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Pfizer    Rezifp is not a word in Hebrew and is being conflated with the West Semitic deity Resheph. Resheph has various spelling and vocalizations but none are “rezifp”.    https://academia.edu/resource/work/5520335  https://academia.edu/resource/work/1797600  https://books.google.com/books?id=RiLoYwdLUekC
note_2_text: Tweet is possibly a joke, but cd be mistaken as a fact claim. Rezifp bears little resemblance to Resheph, the name of the ancient middle-eastern god referred to in the tweet. Worship of Resheph is found in Ugaritic, Phonecian, Aramaic and Egyptian texts beginning 2,500 BC.  https://www.britannica.com/topic/Resheph  https://go.gale.com/ps/i.do?id=GALE%7CA519900109&sid=googleScholar&v=2.1&it=r&linkaccess=abs&issn=07923910&p=AONE&sw=w&userGroupName=nysl_sc_franfl
queries:
1. Meaning of Rezifp in Hebrew
2. Rezifp as a West Semitic god of plague and underworld
3. Pfizer name origin and meaning
refute_evidences: - With official FDA approval, the company was allowed to start marketing the vaccine with an official name, Comirnaty. Pronounced koe-mir'na-tee, the term was designed to represent a mash-up of the words Covid-19, community, immunity, and mRNA, the technology used in the vaccine, writes Insider 's Dr. Catherine Schuster-Bruce, a health reporter and National Health Service medical doctor in the United Kingdom. Reference: https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/meaning-behind-pfizerbiontechs-vaccine-moniker-comirnaty-180978535/ published on 2021-08-30 06:30:00

- Regardless of the exact origins and meanings of the name Resheph and what his godly intentions were said to be, this name is most certainly not "Pfizer" spelled backward. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2023/02/fact-check-pfizer-spelled-backward-rezifp-is-not-god-of-plague-and-underworld.html published on 2023-02-08 13:07:00

- Comirnaty was coined with Co- as the prefix, followed with -mirna as a nod to mRNA, and ends in the -ty suffix, representing both the words community and immunity. The terms community and immunity also allude across the entire name, reports Fierce Pharma. Reference: https://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/meaning-behind-pfizerbiontechs-vaccine-moniker-comirnaty-180978535/ published on 2021-08-30 06:30:00

- The two names are not the same thing. Pfizer spelled backward is Rezifp, which is not Resheph, an ancient deity dating to at least Egyptian times who was described as having a gazelle head or gazelle horns, according to a 2017 review published in The Journal of Egyptian Archaeology. Reference: https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2023/02/fact-check-pfizer-spelled-backward-rezifp-is-not-god-of-plague-and-underworld.html published on 2023-02-08 13:07:00
tweet_text: Pfizer spelled backwards is Rezifp. Rezifp is of Hebrew origin & means (‘the Burner' or 'the Ravager') ancient West Semitic god of the plague & of the underworld. The more you know!
